title: Seven Worlds, One Planet - episode 1, review: David Attenborough's new series is wildlife documentary as high-stakes drama
text:
How much longer can Sir David Attenborough keep this up? The indefatigable 93-year-old naturalist returned for another landmark series in Seven Worlds, One Planet (BBC One, Sunday).

This seven-parter does what it says on the titular tin, exploring a different continent each episode.

Was this enough to differentiate it from Attenborough's previous productions? On the basis of this opening episode, it will do very nicely. It felt weightier and less environmentally finger-waggy than his recent Netflix series, Our Planet.

The eco-message was still there but took a back seat to visual majesty. This was more in the vein of last year’s Dynasties: thrillingly wild and thematically strong.

Attenborough...
description: How much longer can Sir David Attenborough keep this up?
